summary: An FBI email chain from November 2019 forwarding a tip from a former inmate of the Metropolitan Correctional Facility (MCC) who claimed to have information about Jeffrey Epstein's death. The tipster, who was incarcerated at MCC from February to August 2019, stated he knew individuals 'in close proximity' to what happened to Epstein but would only discuss details in person.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the death investigation at the Metropolitan Correctional Facility.

events.title: Tip called into FBI NTOC about Epstein death
events.description: An individual called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report he had information pertaining to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. He claimed to have been incarcerated at MCC from February to August 2019 and knew individuals 'in close proximity' to what happened.

keyFacts: A former inmate of the Metropolitan Correctional Facility contacted the FBI in November 2019 claiming to have information about Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The tipster was incarcerated at MCC from February to August 2019, overlapping with Epstein's detention and death.
The individual stated he knew people 'in close proximity' to what happened to Epstein but refused to provide specifics over the phone, insisting on an in-person meeting.
The FBI email chain shows the tip was forwarded to the agent handling Epstein's death investigation for awareness and potential action.
The document highlights ongoing FBI investigation into Epstein's death following public reports and news coverage.
